understanding_complaint_process.title: Understanding Alberta Police Complaints Process
understanding_complaint_process.description: Alberta has two main oversight bodies: Law Enforcement Review Board (LERB) for municipal police complaints, and Alberta Serious Incident Response Team (ASIRT) for serious incidents.

file_complaint_asirt.title: Report to ASIRT (Serious Incidents)
file_complaint_asirt.description: ASIRT investigates incidents involving police that result in serious injury, death, or allegations of sexual assault or interpersonal violence involving police officers.
file_complaint_asirt.timeframe: Immediate - ASIRT is automatically notified but you can also report directly

file_complaint_police_service.title: File Complaint with Police Service
file_complaint_police_service.description: First file complaint with the police service involved. They have 60 days to investigate and respond.
requiredForms: Police Service Complaint Form (varies by service)

appeal_to_lerb.title: Appeal to Law Enforcement Review Board
appeal_to_lerb.description: If unsatisfied with police service response, appeal to LERB for independent review.
appeal_to_lerb.timeframe: Within 30 days of receiving police service decision

contactInfo.address: Law Enforcement Review Board, 10th Floor, 10025 - 106 Street, Edmonton, AB T5J 1G4

file_complaint_rcmp.title: File RCMP Complaint (if applicable)
file_complaint_rcmp.description: For complaints about RCMP in Alberta, follow federal RCMP complaints process.

understanding_child_protection.title: Understanding Alberta Child Intervention System
understanding_child_protection.description: Alberta Children's Services oversees child intervention. Complaints can be filed through internal processes or external oversight bodies.

internal_complaint.title: File Internal Complaint with Children's Services
internal_complaint.description: File complaint with your local Children's Services office or regional office.

child_youth_advocate.title: Contact Office of the Child and Youth Advocate
child_youth_advocate.description: Independent office that investigates concerns about services provided to children and youth in Alberta.
child_youth_advocate.timeframe: After internal complaint or immediately if urgent

contactInfo.address: Office of the Child and Youth Advocate, Suite 600, 9925 - 109 Street NW, Edmonton, AB T5K 2J8

ombudsman.title: File Complaint with Alberta Ombudsman
ombudsman.description: Ombudsman can investigate complaints about provincial government departments including Children's Services.
